column1: All that night the valiant captain and his men kept a careful and vigilant watch
column2: for the Spanish were almost within gunshot. No sooner had daylight come
column4: than the buccaneers weighed anchor and again set sail
column5: starting their course for the Spanish vessels. The latter
column7: themselves put on sail and moved to meet the attack. The fire ship in its place at the head of the line soon met the largest ship
column8: and instantly grappled itself firmly to her side. Too late the Spaniards discovered their terrible danger
column9: and although they made strenuous efforts to free themselves
column10: they were unable to do so. The flames from the burning vessel seized upon the timber and rigging of the ship
column11: and in a very short space of time consumed the stern of the vessel
column12: leaving the fore part to sink into the sea
